required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Preference, Satisfaction and Ease of Use of Inhalers in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Diagnosed Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Study Evaluating Preference, Satisfaction and Ease of Use of Inhalers in COPD Diagnosed Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Preference study: Genuair vs HandiHaler inhalers in COPD patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Prefer Genuair Device Versus Handihaler Device at Visit 2
primary_outcome.description: Patients will be asked to answer which device they prefer after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Overall Satisfaction With Genuair and Handihaler at Visit 2
secondary_outcome.description: The patient will be asked to rate the overall satisfaction with each device using a Likert-type scale (from 1 [very dissatisfied] to 5 [very satisfied]) after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Making at Least 1 Critical Error Using the Genuair and Handihaler Devices at Visit 2
secondary_outcome.description: The correct use of devices will be assessed measuring the errors made by patients when using each device after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2). Critical error is defined as the one that compromise the potential benefit of the treatment such as those that impede drug deposition in the lungs or delivery of sufficient dose.

intervention.description: Inhaler with only placebo, once daily, 14 days
Inhaler with only placebo, once daily, 14 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult male or female patients aged ≥ 40 with stable COPD
- Naïve patients to the use of study inhalers
- Patients agreeing on participating and signing the Informed Consent Form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with other clinically significant disease, particularly body malformations or diseases affecting coordination and/or motor system
- Patients unable to read product package instructions and answer patient reported questionnaires

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted 4 centres, 2 in The Netherlands and 2 in Germany. The first patient was screened in June 2011 and the last patient visit was in January 2012.

group.title: Placebo Genuair (Daily) Then Placebo HandiHaler (Daily)
group.description: Each morning, patients used the Genuair® (Almirall S.A.) inhaler containing placebo followed by the HandiHaler® (Boehringer Ingelheim) inhaler containing placebo. The study period consisted of 1 period of 14 days.

group.title: Placebo HandiHaler (Daily) Then Placebo Genuair (Daily)
group.description: Each morning, patients used the HandiHaler® (Boehringer Ingelheim) inhaler containing placebo followed by the Genuair® (Almirall S.A.) inhaler containing placebo. The study period consisted of 1 period of 14 days.

participants_list.participants: 1 patient used Handihaler® once only, Genuair® zero times, & was excluded from the safety population

group.title: Overall Study Safety Population
group.description: All patients randomized into the study excluding 1 patient who used Handihaler® once only, Genuair® zero times, & was excluded from the safety population

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Who Prefer Genuair Device Versus Handihaler Device at Visit 2
outcome.description: Patients will be asked to answer which device they prefer after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2)
outcome.population: ITT: all randomized patients who used both devices at least once and expressed a preference for either or neither inhaler. 24 patients (12 each arm) received the incorrect treatment allocation and were excluded from the ITT population. Missing data was handled via the observed cases approach.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Who Prefer Genuair Device Versus Handihaler Device at Visit 2
measure.description: Patients will be asked to answer which device they prefer after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2)
measure.population: ITT: all randomized patients who used both devices at least once and expressed a preference for either or neither inhaler. 24 patients (12 each arm) received the incorrect treatment allocation and were excluded from the ITT population. Missing data was handled via the observed cases approach.

outcome.title: Mean Overall Satisfaction With Genuair and Handihaler at Visit 2
outcome.description: The patient will be asked to rate the overall satisfaction with each device using a Likert-type scale (from 1 [very dissatisfied] to 5 [very satisfied]) after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2)
outcome.population: ITT: all randomized patients who used both devices at least once and expressed a preference for either or neither inhaler. 24 patients from the safety population (12 each arm) received the incorrect treatment allocation and were excluded from the ITT population. Missing data were handled via the observed cases approach.

measure.title: Mean Overall Satisfaction With Genuair and Handihaler at Visit 2
measure.description: The patient will be asked to rate the overall satisfaction with each device using a Likert-type scale (from 1 [very dissatisfied] to 5 [very satisfied]) after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2)
measure.population: ITT: all randomized patients who used both devices at least once and expressed a preference for either or neither inhaler. 24 patients from the safety population (12 each arm) received the incorrect treatment allocation and were excluded from the ITT population. Missing data were handled via the observed cases approach.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Making at Least 1 Critical Error Using the Genuair and Handihaler Devices at Visit 2
outcome.description: The correct use of devices will be assessed measuring the errors made by patients when using each device after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2). Critical error is defined as the one that compromise the potential benefit of the treatment such as those that impede drug deposition in the lungs or delivery of sufficient dose.
outcome.population: ITT: all randomized patients who used both devices at least once and expressed a preference for either or neither inhaler. 24 patients from the safety population (12 each arm) received the incorrect treatment allocation and were excluded from the ITT population. Missing data were handled via the observed cases approach.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Making at Least 1 Critical Error Using the Genuair and Handihaler Devices at Visit 2
measure.description: The correct use of devices will be assessed measuring the errors made by patients when using each device after 2 weeks of daily practice (visit 2). Critical error is defined as the one that compromise the potential benefit of the treatment such as those that impede drug deposition in the lungs or delivery of sufficient dose.
measure.population: ITT: all randomized patients who used both devices at least once and expressed a preference for either or neither inhaler. 24 patients from the safety population (12 each arm) received the incorrect treatment allocation and were excluded from the ITT population. Missing data were handled via the observed cases approach.

group.title: Genuair Then HandiHaler
group.description: The study period consisted of 1 period of 14 days. Every morning patients used the Genuair® (Almirall S.A.) inhaler containing placebo follow by the HandiHaler® (Boehringer Ingelheim) inhaler containing placebo.

group.title: HandiHaler Then Genuair
group.description: The study period consisted of 1 period of 14 days. Every morning patients used the HandiHaler® (Boehringer Ingelheim)inhaler containing placebo follow by the Genuair® (Almirall S.A.) inhaler containing placebo.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All the information related to this clinical trial is considered strictly confidential and is the property of Almirall. This information will not be given to a third party without the written consent of Almirall. Publication and/or presentation, whether complete or partial, of any part of the data or results of this trial will be subject to revision and written agreement between the investigator and Almirall.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Clinical Project Leader and Trial Manager
